register.description: Core module clock gating controls: allows clocks to be forced off, forced on or operate under automatic pipeline activity based clock gating.

bitfield.description: Automatic Register Power Management Control

bitenum.description: Register updates automatically turn on clock domains
Manual clock domain control for register updates

bitfield.description: Clock gating control for the USSE

bitenum.description: Clock gating is active and no clock is supplied to the USSE
Clock to the USSE is enabled
Automatic gating is active, the USSE clock is only active whilst data is being processed

bitfield.description: Clock gating control for the DPM

bitenum.description: Clock gating is active and no clock is supplied to the DPM
Clock to the DPM is enabled
Automatic gating is active, the DPM clock is only active whilst data is being processed

bitfield.description: Clock gating control for the TA

bitenum.description: Clock gating is active and no clock is supplied to the TA
Clock to the TA is enabled
Automatic gating is active, the TA clock is only active whilst data is being processed

bitfield.description: Clock gating control for the TSP

bitenum.description: Clock gating is active and no clock is supplied to the TSP
Clock to the TSP is enabled
Automatic gating is active, the TSP clock is only active whilst data is being processed

bitfield.description: Clock gating control for the ISP

bitenum.description: Clock gating is active and no clock is supplied to the ISP
Clock to the ISP is enabled
Automatic gating is active, the ISP clock is only active whilst data is being processed

register.description: Clock Gating Status reflects the condition of the clock gate controls for each module.

bitfield.description: Status of the USSE clock

bitenum.description: USSE clock is gated and the module is inactive
Clock to the USSE is running

bitfield.description: Status of the DPM clock

bitenum.description: DPM clock is gated and the module is inactive
Clock to the DPM is running

bitfield.description: Status of the TA clock

bitenum.description: TA clock is gated and the module is inactive
Clock to the TA is running

bitfield.description: Status of the TSP clock

bitenum.description: TSP clock is gated and the module is inactive
Clock to the TSP is running

bitfield.description: Status of the ISP clock

bitenum.description: ISP clock is gated and the module is inactive
Clock to the ISP is running

register.description: Core module clock gating override controls: allows clocks to be enabled temporarily for register writes by hosts.

bitfield.description: Clock gating control override for the USSE

bitenum.description: Host enable clock to the USSE request
Host disable clock to USSE request. USSE clock may be gated if not other outstanding host requests.

bitfield.description: Clock gating control override for the DPM

bitenum.description: Clock to the DPM is enabled
Host disable clock to DPM request. DPM clock may be gated if not other outstanding host requests.

bitfield.description: Clock gating control override for the TA

bitenum.description: Clock to the TA is enabled
Host disable clock to TA request. TA clock may be gated if not other outstanding host requests.

bitfield.description: Clock gating control override for the TSP

bitenum.description: Clock to the TSP is enabled
Host disable clock to TSP request. TSP clock may be gated if no other outstanding host requests.

bitfield.description: Clock gating control override for the ISP

bitenum.description: Clock to the ISP is enabled
Host disable clock to ISP request. ISP clock may be gated if no other outstanding host requests.

register.description: Core ID Register

bitfield.description: Core ID
Core Configuration

register.description: Core Revision Register identifies the specific core revision. This is updated to reflect the formal release status of the core.

bitfield.description: Designer Field
Major Revision
Minor Revision
Maintenance Revision

register.description: Designer Revision Field. The SOC designer can use this register for their own revision control if required.

bitfield.description: Designer Field

register.description: Designer Revision Field The SOC designer can use this register for their own revision control if required.

bitfield.description: Designer Field

register.description: Within SGX there are a number of performance counters which enable profiling of an application in terms of the low level hardware performance; this register enables selection of specific groups of performance counters and the ability to reset those counters. Full details can be found in the performance profiling section of this document. Write a '1' followed by a '0' to the _CLR fields to reset the specific counter

bitfield.description: 0x0 Core Overview counter group. Default value is set to 0xF, no counter will be in operation

bitenum.description: Primitive Clipping counter group
Scene Buffer counter group
ISP counter group
TSP counter group
USE counter group
Texturing counter group
Core Overview 2 counter group

bitfield.description: Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'
Reset counter = '1', normal counter operation '0'

register.description: Performance counter 0 status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Performance counter 1 status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Performance counter 2 status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Performance counter 3 status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Performance counter 5 status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Performance counter 6 status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Performance counter 7 status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Performance counter status register

bitfield.description: 32 bit integer count value, see performance profiling section for details

register.description: Soft reset control register which drives all modules except the register bank. Write a '1' to reset and a '0' to clear

bitfield.description: TSP soft reset control field
ISP soft reset control field
USE soft reset control field
TA soft reset control field
DPM soft reset control field
BIF soft reset control field

register.description: TA/3D Lockup counter timeout value (16K cycle granularity) (Debug only, for further information contact Imagination Technologies)

bitfield.description: Trigger count value in 16K cycles for TA and 3D lockup triggers

register.description: This register enables interrupts. Writing a '1' to a bit field enables the relevant Event. All the bit fields correspond exactly to those in the EUR_CR_EVENT_STATUS2 register. The MASTER_INTERRUPT bit is a global enable which overrides the Event enables, i.e. '1' - enable external interrupts, '0' - disable external interrupts.

bitfield.description: Host_Enable: Lockup in TA Phase Trigger
Host_Enable: Lockup in 3d Phase Trigger
Host_Enable: Deadlock has occurred after a Partial Render
Host_Enable: DPM 3D Free Load task complete
Host_Enable: DPM TA Free Load task complete

register.description: This register is used to clear event interrupts. Writing a '1' to a bit field clears the relevant Event. All the bit fields correspond exactly to those in the EUR_CR_EVENT_STATUS2 register.

bitfield.description: Host_Clear: Lockup in TA Phase Trigger
Host_Clear: Lockup in 3d Phase Trigger
Host_Clear: Deadlock has occurred after a Partial Render
Host_Clear: DPM 3D Free Load task complete
Host_Clear: DPM TA Free Load task complete

register.description: There are 2 sources of external interrupts in the PowerVR SGX core: General system events and PDS cache invalidation events. The event status2 register indicates the source of any general event interrupt generated by PowerVR SGX. These events only result in an external interrupt if the relevant bit in the EUR_CR_EVENT_HOST_ENABLE register is set. Note1: This register must be combined with the EUR_CR_PDS_CACHE_STATUS register information to determine what has caused the external interrupt. Note2: The host can write to this register in which case any bits written as a '1' are ORed into the register i.e. the host can cause the core to generate an interrupt. (This is typically for debug purposes only)

bitfield.description: Status: Lockup in TA Phase Trigger
Status: Lockup in 3d Phase Trigger
Status: Deadlock has occurred after a Partial Render
Status: DPM 3D free load task complete
Status: DPM TA free load task complete

register.description: There are 2 sources of external interrupts in the PowerVR SGX core: General system events and PDS cache invalidation events. The event status register indicates the source of any general event interrupt generated by PowerVR SGX. These events only result in an external interrupt if the relevant bit in the EUR_CR_EVENT_HOST_ENABLE register is set. Note1: This register must be combined with the EUR_CR_PDS_CACHE_STATUS register information to determine what has caused the external interrupt. Note2: The host can write to this register in which case any bits written as a '1' are ORed into the register i.e. the host can cause the core to generate an interrupt. (This is typically for debug purposes only)

bitfield.description: Status: PowerVR SGX Master Interrupt Control
Status: The PDS Event timer interrupt (signalled on timer traversing through 0).
Status: The TA Object Passing System has got out of sync, a Terminate Control Word DPM read was met by StartofBlock data
Status: Invalidate of Madd L0, L1, L2 Cache Complete
Status: Memory Allocation Failed for ZLS
Status: All memory associated with TA context has been freed
Status: ISP End tile
Status: DPM Initialisation Complete
Status: The OTPM has loaded its state
Status: The OTPM has invalidated its contents
Status: The OTPM has flushed its state
Status: End of Scene
Status: ISP Halt breakpoint triggered
Status: Visibility Test Fail
Status: ISP Breakpoint
Status: Software triggered event
Status: TA complete - This is set and held high after the TE terminates scene, until TA is restarted
Status: The TA terminate complete (issue as part of complex scene) - This is set and held high after the TE aborts a MacroTile after failed DPM allocation request, until TA is restarted
Status: The TPC has reset its state
Status: The TPC has stored its state
Status: The reset of the DPM control context has been completed
Status: The load of the DPM control context has been completed
Status: The store of the DPM control context has been completed
Status: The reset of the DPM state context has been completed
Status: The load of the DPM state context has been completed
Status: The store of the DPM state context has been completed
Status: DPM Memory allocation has reached the preset memory threshold for total memory allocation
Status: DPM Memory allocation failed for the global list
Status: DPM Memory allocation failed for a macro tile
Status: DPM Memory allocation complete for the current render

register.description: This register enables interrupts. Writing a '1' to a bit field enables the relevant Event. All the bit fields correspond exactly to those in the EUR_CR_EVENT_STATUS register. The MASTER_INTERRUPT bit is a global enable which overrides the Event enables, i.e. '1' - enable external interrupts, '0' - disable external interrupts.

bitfield.description: Host_Enable: PowerVR SGX Master Interrupt Control
Host_Enable: The PDS Event timer interrupt (signalled on timer traversing through 0).
Host_Enable: The Tiling Co-Processor Object Passing System has got out of sync, a Terminate Control Word DPM read was met by StartofBlock data

Host_Enable: The TPC has reset its state

Host_Enable: The reset of the DPM control context has been completed

Host_Enable: DPM Memory allocation failed for the global list
Host_Enable: DPM Memory allocation failed for a macro tile
Host_Enable: DPM Memory allocation complete for the current render

register.description: This register is used to clear event interrupts. Writing a '1' to a bit field clears the relevant Event. All the bit fields correspond exactly to those in the EUR_CR_EVENT_STATUS register.

bitfield.description: Host_Clear: PowerVR SGX Master Interrupt
Host_Clear: The PDS Event timer interrupt (signalled on timer traversing through 0).
Host_Clear: The TA Object Passing System has got out of sync, a Terminate Control Word DPM read was met by StartofBlock data

Host_Clear: DPM Memory allocation failed for the global list

register.description: There are 2 sources of external interrupts in the PowerVR SGX core: General system events and PDS cache invalidation events. The PDS cache status register indicates the source of any PDS cache invalidation event interrupts generated by PowerVR SGX. These events only result in an external interrupt if the relevant bit in the EUR_CR_PDS_CACHE_HOST_ENABLE register is set. Note1: This register must be combined with the EUR_CR_EVENT_STATUS register information to determine what has caused the external interrupt. Note2: The host can write to this register in which case any bits written as a '1' are ORed into the register i.e. the host can cause the core to generate an interrupt. (This is typically for debug purposes only)

bitfield.description: Status: Context ID 3 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Status: Context ID 2 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Status: Context ID 1 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Status: Context ID 0 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Status: Context ID 3 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Status: Context ID 2 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Status: Context ID 1 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Status: Context ID 0 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Status: PDS Code Store Cache has been invalidated

register.description: This register enables interrupts. Writing a '1' to a bit field enables the relevant Event. All the bit fields correspond exactly to those in the EUR_CR_PDS_CACHE_STATUS register. The MASTER_INTERRUPT bit contained in the EUR_CR_EVENT_HOST_ENABLE register is a global enable which overrides the Event enables, i.e. '1' - enable external interrupts, '0' - disable external interrupts.

bitfield.description: Host_Enable: Context ID 3 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Enable: Context ID 2 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Enable: Context ID 1 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Enable: Context ID 0 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Enable: Context ID 3 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Enable: Context ID 2 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Enable: Context ID 1 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Enable: Context ID 0 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Enable: PDS Code Store Cache has been invalidated

register.description: This register is used to clear event interrupts. Writing a '1' to a bit field clears the relevant Event. All the bit fields correspond exactly to those in the EUR_CR_PDS_CACHE_STATUS register.

bitfield.description: Host_Clear: Context ID 3 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Clear: Context ID 2 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Clear: Context ID 1 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Clear: Context ID 0 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1
Host_Clear: Context ID 3 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Clear: Context ID 2 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Clear: Context ID 1 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Clear: Context ID 0 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 0
Host_Clear: PDS Code Store Cache has been invalidated

register.description: Any write to this register starts the Vertex Data Master DMA operation

bitfield.description: Start VDM DMA

register.description: This register controls the anti-aliasing mode of the Tiling Co-Processor, independent control is provided in both X & Y axis.

bitfield.description: Anti-Aliasing in X:

bitenum.description: No Anti-Aliasing on X plane
Anti-Aliasing on X plane

bitfield.description: Anti-Aliasing in Y:

bitenum.description: No Anti-Aliasing on Y plane
Anti-Aliasing on Y plane

register.description: The Tiling Co-Processor allocates memory in macrotiles, which is a group of individual tiles. The number of macrotiles is selectable between 4 & 16, the boundaries of the macrotiles in the X axis are defined in this register.

bitenum.description: 4 MacroTiles
16 MacroTiles

bitfield.description: X1 MacroTile boundary, left tile X for second column of macrotiles (16MT mode)
X2 MacroTile boundary, left tile X for second(4MT)/third(16MT) column of macrotiles
X3 MacroTile boundary, left tile X for fourth column of macrotiles (16MT)

register.description: The Tiling Co-Processor allocates memory in macrotiles, which is a group of individual tiles. The number of macrotiles is selectable between 4 & 16, the boundaries of the macrotiles in the Y axis are defined in this register.

bitfield.description: Y1 MacroTile boundary, top tile Y for second row of macrotiles (16MT mode)
Y2 MacroTile boundary, top tile Y for second(4MT)/third(16MT) row of macrotiles
Y1 MacroTile boundary, top tile Y for fourth row of macrotiles (16MT mode)

register.description: In order to perform the tiling operation and generate the display list the maximum screen size must be configured in terms of the number of tiles in X & Y axis.

bitfield.description: Maximum Y tile address visible on screen
Maximum X tile address visible on screen

register.description: This register defines the number of individual tiles within the macrotiles. This is used in the process of memory allocation.

bitfield.description: Number of tiles in a Macrotile. Stride = (XTile * YTiles)

register.description: This register defines the global control for the Parameter Stream Generator within the Tiling Co-Processor. This module formats the display list generated by the Tiling Co-Processor.

bitfield.description: Enables sampling of Driver TE_STATE_ISP_STATE_ID register on context switch/restore when set, when reset current local value is preserved.
Don't invalidate Tail Pointer Cache entries on a Terminate command. Only effective when COMPLETEONTERMINATE is 0x0

bitenum.description: Do Invalidate
Don't Invalidate

bitfield.description: 0x1 Write region headers, terminate streams and invalidate tail pointer cache entries on terminate.

bitenum.description: If ZONLYRENDER = 0x0 then force an Interrupt, however if ZONLYRENDER = 0x1 then write region headers and terminate streams.

bitfield.description: If 0x1 set the zload enable bit in the region headers. If 0x0 the region header zload bit is controlled by the hardware automatically. The bit is set if a partial render has been performed on that tile.

If 0x1 set the zstore enable bit in the region headers. If 0x0 the region header zstore bit is controlled by the hardware automatically. The bit is set if a partial render is about to be performed on that tile.

Pad empty doublewords in allocation with zeros after Stream Link/Terminate. The allocation block size is 16 DWords, so potentially inserts 13 extra DWords of zeros into a pointer block. Debug only. Makes examination of memory more readable on a per frame basis.
Always embed state information in control stream. Debug only.

register.description: This register defines the base address in memory of the Region Header writes by the TA. Region headers are the first part of the display list and contain an entry per tile with information on global setup and a link address to parameters.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 512-bit aligned Base Address for Region Header writes

register.description: This register defines the base address in memory of the Tail Pointer Cache. A tail pointer is the current last address written to for a tiles individual display list, an entry for active tiles is maintained as primitives are processed by the TA.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 512-bit aligned Base Address for Tail Pointer Cache. The tail pointer is the current last address written to for a control stream for a tile.

register.description: The Tail Pointer Cache is used to keep track of the last address written to for a particular tile, this is stored in a mixture of on chip cache and external memory. Under certain circumstances it is necessary to either reset the cache or flush the on chip cache contents such that they are visible in memory.

bitfield.description: Reset contents of Tail Pointer Cache
Flush contents of Tail Pointer Cache to Memory

register.description: Reset or enabled by the MTE_RESETBBOX and MTE_UPDATEBBOX fields in the MTEControl word of the Input Parameter format. This is the maximum extent in X of the post transformed, clipped data before region clipping.

bitfield.description: XMax value for maintained Region Generator Bounding Box
XMin value for maintained Region Generator Bounding Box

register.description: Reset or enabled by the MTE_RESETBBOX and MTE_UPDATEBBOX fields in the MTE Control word of the Input Parameter format. This is the maximum extent in Y of the post transformed, clipped data before region clipping.

bitfield.description: YMax value for maintained Region Generator Bounding Box
YMin value for maintained Region Generator Bounding Box

register.description: The TA maintains internal state of the current information for each macro tile and global list regarding the vertex blocks written to memory. In certain circumstances during a context switch it is necessary to flush this information to external memory.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 512-bit aligned Base Address for Object Tail Pointer Memory Context Switchable Memory (OTPM CSM) Flush. This is the current point for each macro tile and global list, for the vertex blocks written to memory by the Tile Accelerator.

register.description: The TA maintains internal state of the current information for each macro tile and global list regarding the vertex blocks written to memory. In certain circumstances during a context switch it is necessary to load this information from external memory.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 512-bit aligned Base Address for Object Tail Pointer Memory Context Switchable Memory (OTPM CSM) Load. This is the current point for each macro tile and global list, for the vertex blocks written to memory by the Tile Accelerator.

register.description: PowerVR SGX masters information from memory using advanced DMA, this register defines the base address of the Vertex Data input control stream in memory.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, byte aligned Base Address for Vertex Data control streams

register.description: This register controls the global setup of the Tiling Process.

bitfield.description: Maximum number of partitions which can be used per USSE pipeline:
Select OpenGL or D3D mode
Disable for perfect small object culling

bitenum.description: Perfect small object culling enabled
Perfect small object culling disabled

bitfield.description: Enable W clamping

bitenum.description: W clamping disabled
W clamping enabled

bitfield.description: When writing to global list, number of primitives which are within the same macrotile before the macrotile calculation will change from global.
Compare value for W clamping. See the Input parameter format, viewport transform for details. Compare is applied post viewport transform.
Clamp value for W clamping. See the Input parameter format, viewport transform for details. Clamp is applied post viewport transform, if the w value is less than the WCOMPARE value.

register.description: In order to perform the tiling operation and generate the display list the maximum screen size must be configured in terms of the number of pixels in X & Y axis since this may not be the same as the number of tiles defined in the EUR_CR_TE_SCREEN register.

bitfield.description: Screen height in pixels.
Screen width in pixels.

register.description: The TA maintains internal state of the current information for each macro tile and global list regarding the vertex blocks written to memory. In certain circumstances during a context switch it is necessary to load or flush this information to external memory.

bitfield.description: Flush CSM contents to CSM Flush Address
Load CSM contents from CSM Load Address
Invalidate CSM contents

register.description: This applies when anti-aliasing is enabled. This is used to calculate whether an anti-aliased triangle can be perfect small object culled.

bitfield.description: Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 4th multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 4th multisample X position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 3rd multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 3rd multisample X position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 2nd multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 2nd multisample X position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 1st multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 1st multisample X position
Signature of output to TE. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Signature of output to memory. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.

register.description: This register is read on VDM_START_PULSE and should be saved and updated by the driver app by app

bitfield.description: This register contains the PSG internal ISP State ID Counter value. It must be saved off by the driver on TA terminate or finished and restored before vdm_start_pulse.
A read of this register returns the page allocated to the host, when valid. If it is not valid the return data is undefined.

Signature of Barycentric vertices output during each clipping pass i.e. clipped against each clip plane in turn. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Signature of data output from PBE to BIF. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Signature of control data output from PBE to BIF. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.

register.description: Start VDM Context store, pulse kicks off the store operation. Status flags when this is complete and the stream and index position registers are valid

bitfield.description: Start VDM Context store

register.description: Stores the stream position when the context store occured

bitfield.description: stream position for context store, number of 32bit dwords from a base address update (ie. between stream link or terminates)

register.description: Stores the index position when the context store occured

bitfield.description: Index position for context store, number of index words from an index define

register.description: Signals when a context store is complete and the stream and index location registers are valid

bitfield.description: Context store not applicable doing a stream terminate
Context store processing
Context store complete

register.description: Terminate state control registers used for creating the terminate PDS task.

bitfield.description: defines the last word in the control stream, used to generate end ta
defines if the state update is complex
Base address (128Bit Aligned, 256 MByte range), in 16 byte units of the PDS code and data to be executed

register.description: Terminate state control registers used for creating the terminate PDS task.

bitfield.description: Size of the PDS Data segment in 128 bit words. The data segment always precedes the code segment. 0 = 0x0, Max = 0x20
Enables breakpoints on this program
If set the USSE will output state to the MTE
0 ' Do not execute secondary task on the USSE/1 ' Execute secondary task on the USSE Has no effect on primary tasks.
Indicates a sequential dependency
0 ' Reserved/1 ' Run on pipe 1/2 ' Run on pipe 2/3 ' Run on both pipes
Indicates partial secondary updates.
Number of output partitions required. 0 = 0x0 and Max = 0x4
Indicates that the allocation is secondary
Size of the USSE Attribute Requirements for the task in 128 bit Words

register.description: Indicates the status on the control stream fetch

bitfield.description: Indicates when state machine is in idle

register.description: Stores the number of indices since the last wrap

bitfield.description: Wrap Index Count for context store, number of indices since last wrap

register.description: Indicates the number of times that index wrapping has occurred after a context store

bitfield.description: Wrapped count for context store, number of times the hardware has wrapped after a context store

register.description: The driver sets this register on a context switch such that the hardware can resume knowing where the centre point of a fan is located or the winding order of the strip, expressed as an index.

bitfield.description: Controls setting of the winding order for the primitive about to be resumed
An enable bit, 1 = valid and triggers the use of the index indicated in bits 23:0. (Valid only on a VDM_START_PULSE)
Context store, index to be used as center point to Fan after a context store.

register.description: Indicates the number of times that index wrapping has occurred after a context store

bitfield.description: Indicates control of the value to be used in the next index block (1 = context wrap counter + 1,0 = reset context wrap counter)
An enable bit, 1 = valid and triggers the use of the wrap count value indicated in bits 21:0. (Valid only on a VDM_START_PULSE)
Context store, wrap counter value used on a resume

register.description: The PixelBE modules format the pixel data before writing to memory, this register contains global control signals.

bitfield.description: Use Frame buffer address for IDF's when set to 1. Default is 0 which means IDFs use the last address written too by the PBE
Alpha threshold used when encoding 1555 format. If the internal 8bit Alpha value exceeds this value, then a 1 is written to the top bit of the output, otherwise a 0 is written

register.description: The Image Synthesis Processor can be configured to operate in 3 different render modes

bitfield.description: Render type

bitenum.description: = Normal 3D render
= Normal 3D render
= Fast 2D render
= Fast scale render

register.description: This register defines the base address in memory of the Region Header reads by the ISP. Region headers are the first part of the display list and contain an entry per tile with information on global setup and a link address to parameters.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, Dword aligned Base Address for Region Header Reads

register.description: When the render type is set to Fast 2D Render or Fast Scale Render, no region headers are read from memory. Instead, region headers are internally generated for all tiles enclosed in the bounding box defined by this register and the EUR_CR_ISP_RENDBOX2 register.

bitfield.description: Bounding box X1. X address, in tiles, of top left most tile in bounding box. The LSB is ignored if AA_MODE is low.
Bounding box Y1. Y address, in tiles, of top left most tile in bounding box. The LSB is ignored if AA_MODE is low.

register.description: When the render type is set to Fast 2D Render or Fast Scale Render, no region headers are read from memory. Instead, region headers are internally generated for all tiles enclosed in the bounding box defined by this register and the EUR_CR_ISP_RENDBOX1 register.

bitfield.description: Bounding box X2. X address, in tiles, of bottom right most tile in bounding box. The LSB is ignored if AA_MODE is low.
Bounding box Y2. Y address, in tiles, of bottom right most tile in bounding box.The LSB is ignored if AA_MODE is low.

register.description: Global control register for the ISP parameter fetch.

bitfield.description: Scale factor for ISP parameter fetch to BIF TTE.
Initial upass_ctrl value, loaded at the start of each tile, for user pass spawning in the ISP.

If this bit is set, all empty regions encountered will be processed by the 3D core ie the hardware background object being rendered in each empty tile. NOTE that this bit does not affect a "Fast Scale Render" i.e. empty regions are always processed when performing a "Fast Scale Render".
6 bit field specify the minimum object ID required for opaque and translucent objects to be rendered.

register.description: Global control register which modifies the pixel sample position to comply with OGL requirements.

bitfield.description: 0 Non OGL Rules

bitenum.description: Non OGL Rules
OGL Rules

bitfield.description: If the determinant in the ISP FPU is smaller than this unsigned float, then perpendicular maths is used.
If the determinant in the ISP FPU is smaller than this unsigned float, then the triangle is culled.
Signed 2's complement integer used to control the slope dependent part of depth bias. The default value should be -23.
Signed 2's complement integer used to control the slope independent part of depth bias. The default value should be 0.

register.description: Any write to this register starts a 3D Render.

bitfield.description: Start 3D render

register.description: Indicates to the 3D pipeline whether anti-aliasing is enabled or disabled

bitenum.description: anti aliasing disabled
anti aliasing enabled

register.description: Object breakpoints can be inserted by the driver to interrupt a render part way and then resume the render from the point of interrupt at a later time, this register controls what happens when a breakpoint has been encountered.

bitfield.description: Resumes the current render after a breakpoint object is encountered in the internal parameter stream
Terminates the current render after a breakpoint object is encountered in the internal parameter stream

ISP Context Store, any write to this register will cause the ISP to halt processing new primitives, insert an end of render command and wait for the current primitives in the pipeline to complete processing up to the inserted end of render.
ISP FPU signature result. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Any write to this register will invalidate the Content Addressable Memory in the TSP parameter fetch cache
Scale factor for TSP parameter fetch to BIF TTE.

register.description: Image Synthesis Processor Z Load/Store & format global control register

bitfield.description: This bit modifies the behaviour when ISP_ZLSCTL:[ZSTOREFORMAT] = 0x0. 0 - Binary 0 is stored in place of the current rendered mask plane. All stored Z values will appear in memory as positive IEEE floats; 1 - The mask plane is stored per pixel location a rendered to the on-chip tile buffer and occupies the MSB (sign bit) of all IEEE float dwords

This bit modifies the behaviour when ISP_ZLSCTL:[ZLOADFORMAT] = 0x0. 0 - The entire tile will be loaded with the mask plane value as determined by ISP_BGOBJ:[MASK]; 1 - The mask plane is loaded exactly as it appears in memory with the mask plane bit in the MSB (sign bit) of each loaded IEEE float formatted dword

When set, only the Z buffer is rendered. Opaque and translucent objects are stencil and depth tested as usual but no pixel spans are emitted to the PDS Pixel presenter. Pixels within punch through and depth feedback objects are emitted on their first pass as a result of passing the up-front depth test by default. However, on their feedback depth test, these pixels will not be output regardless of the depth test result. The intention is to calculate a scene Z buffer without doing any further rendering.

Selects the format depth, stencil and viewport is stored in: 0x0 32 bit IEEE SP Float; 0x1 24 bit Integer + 8-bit Stencil; 0x2 Two 16 bit Integers (Packed format); 0x3 32-bit IEEE Float 8-bit Stencil 1-bit Viewport Compressed, addressed using DPM

Selects the format depth, stencil and viewport is stored in: 0x0 32 bit IEEE SP Float; 0x1 24 bit Integer + 8-bit Stencil; 0x2 Two 16 bit Integers (Packed format); 0x3 32-bit IEEE Float 8-bit Stencil 1-bit Viewport Compressed, addressed using DPM
Display width in tiles (16 pixels) minus one: 0x00 1 tile (16 pixels) 0x01 2 tiles (32 pixels) .. 0xFF 256 tiles (4096 pixels)
When set to 1, if the ZSTORE bit in the region header is also set then the stencil buffer is stored to memory after each tile is processed
If set to 1 the depth/stencil buffer is always stored at the end of each tile irrespective of the region header ZSTORE bit.
If set to 1 the depth/stencil buffer is always loaded at the start of each tile irrespective of the region header ZLOAD bit.
When set to 1, if the ZSTORE bit in the region header is also set then the depth buffer is stored to memory after each tile is processed
When set to 1 depth and stencil data is written out in "Tiled" order. (Note: Data can not be written as tiled, if the ZSTOREFORMAT = 0x3. In this case STORETILED should be set to 0)
When set to 1, if the ZLOAD bit in the region header is also set then the depth buffer is read from memory prior to tile processing
When set to 1, if the ZLOAD bit in the region header is also set then the stencil buffer is read from memory prior to tile processing
When set to 1 depth, stencil data is loaded in "Tiled" order (Note: Data can not be read as tiled, if the ZSTOREFORMAT = 0x3. In this case LOADTILED should be set to 0)

register.description: This register defines the base address in memory of the Z Buffer base address to load into the ISP for non-compressed ZLS formats.

bitfield.description: 64MB Addressable, 16byte aligned Base Address of the Z Buffer Load base address

register.description: This register defines the base address in memory of the Z Buffer base address to store data from the ISP for non-compressed ZLS formats.

bitfield.description: 64MB Addressable, 16byte aligned Base Address of the Z Buffer Load base address

register.description: This register defines the base address in memory of the Stencil Buffer base address to load into the ISP for Int24 and IEEE ZLS formats. This alternate stencil buffer base address is selectable based on the enable bit.

bitfield.description: When set to 1, enables fetching of stencil from a separate base address
64MB Addressable, 16byte aligned Base Address of the Stencil Buffer Load base address

register.description: This register defines the base address in memory of the Stencil Buffer base address to store data from the ISP for Int24 and IEEE ZLS formats. This alternate stencil buffer base address is selectable based on the enable bit.

bitfield.description: When set to 1, enables saving of stencil to a separate base address
64MB Addressable, 16byte aligned Base Address of the Stencil Buffer Load base address

register.description: This register can be used to reset the results of the 8 visibility test results. Write a 1 to the required bit field to clear the result register

bitfield.description: Resets Visibility Test register 7
Resets Visibility Test register 6
Resets Visibility Test register 5
Resets Visibility Test register 4
Resets Visibility Test register 3
Resets Visibility Test register 2
Resets Visibility Test register 1
Resets Visibility Test register 0
Visibility Test counter 0
Visibility Test counter 1
Visibility Test counter 2
Visibility Test counter 3
Visibility Test counter 4
Visibility Test counter 5
Visibility Test counter 6
Visibility Test counter 7

register.description: The ISP operates by comparing depth values of incoming objects with the results of previous depth compares, in order to make sure there are no un-initialised values at the start of the tile or to cover pixels where there are no objects in the scene a default background object is configured under register control. This register provides the floating point depth value for this background object.

bitfield.description: Hardware background object depth value in 32 bit IEEE single precision floating point format

register.description: The ISP operates by comparing depth values of incoming objects with the results of previous depth compares, in order to make sure there is no un-initialised values at the start of the tile or to cover pixels where there are no objects in the scene a default background object is configured under register control. This register provides tag, mask and stencil information for this background object.

bitfield.description: When set to 1, at the start of each tile the ISP tag buffer is initialised with the background object tag (default = 1)
Hardware background object mask plane
Hardware background object stencil

register.description: The ISP operates by comparing depth values of incoming objects with the results of previous depth compares, in order to make sure there are no unitialised values at the start of the tile or to cover pixels where there are no objects in the scene a default background object is configured under register control. This register provides TSP and Vertex information for this background object.

bitfield.description: Hardware background object TSP data size in dwords
Bits 25:4 of the hardware background object vertex pointer (64MB range on 16 byte boundaries)

register.description: This applies when anti-aliasing is enabled. This is used by the ISP to adjust the sample positions.

bitfield.description: Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 4th multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 4th multisample X position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 3rd multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 3rd multisample X position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 2nd multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 2nd multisample X position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 1st multisample Y position
Unsigned sub-pixel offset for the 1st multisample X position
Signature analysis - face equation precalc. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Signature analysis - edge processors. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Signature analysis - state buffer storage. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Signature analysis - spans to PDS pixel presenter. A signature is an accumulative LFSR (Linear Feedback Shift Register) of the valid pipeline data using an XOR structure.
Debug punchthrough, converts fast punchthrough to normal punchthrough
Debug punchthrough mode which forces pt_off after every pt,dfb and fpt triangle
Safe flush mode, pass-spawn flushes for every translucent object
Control Stream Position after context switch
Position of current primitive after context switch
Tile Y coordinate after context switch
Tile X coordinate after context switch
deterministic mode for depth sorter

register.description: This register indicates if the PixelBE would stall the USE if there were another emit. '1' indicates that the PixelBE would stall the USE. '0' indicates that the PixelBE would not stall the USE.

bitfield.description: Pipe 1 status
Pipe 0 status

register.description: Effective on load 3D context, this register defines the base address of the page table being referenced in the process of de-allocating pages during a 3D render.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 16Byte aligned Base Address for 3D context page tables in the DPM module

register.description: Between the FREE_LIST_HEAD and FREE_LIST_TAIL there must be a valid chain of linked pages. The linked list is stored in memory, at the EUR_CR_DPM_3D_PAGE_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS and is effective on load 3D context.

bitfield.description: This register defines the last page to be used for the 3D page allocation, on a load 3D context. (The tail of the free list.)
This register defines the first page to be used for the 3D page allocation, on a load 3D context.

register.description: This is the threshold in 4KB pages at which the hardware will stop double buffering the internal vertex processing buffers (and drop to single buffered mode). This is required in order to guarantee that a 3D render can run when running in dynamic parameter management mode. It should be set to 0.25MB less (in pages 0x40) than the ZLS threshold (or 0 in very small memory systems).

bitfield.description: Page Threshold at which vertex buffers stop being double buffered

register.description: Effective on Loading the TA Page Table Context, this register defines the base address of the page table being referenced in the process of allocating pages by the TE and MTE.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 16Byte aligned Base Address for TE/MTE context page tables in the DPM module.

register.description: Between the FREE_LIST_HEAD and FREE_LIST_TAIL there must be a valid chain of linked pages. The linked list is stored in memory, at the EUR_CR_DPM_TA_ALLOC_PAGE_TABLE_BASE_ADDRESS and is effective on Loading the TA Page Table Context.

bitfield.description: This register defines the last page for the free list manipulated during TE and MTE page allocation
This register defines the start page for the free list manipulated during TE and MTE page allocation
Effective on Loading the TA Page Table Context, the maximum number of pages to allocate before signaling almost out of memory.

Effective on Loading the TA Page Table Context, the maximum number of pages to allocate before signaling out of memory to the host. The ZLS threshold should be set such that sufficient pages are left available to the ZLS module when it performs its dynamic memory allocation upon a partial render. The number of pages spare should be set to be larger than the maximum pages for 1 macro tile of Z data. For example: If 4 pages are required for 1 macro tile of Z, and there are 50 pages in the system, then this threshold should be set to 50 - 4 = 46.
Effective on Loading the TA Page Table Context, a value of 1 in this field enables the global list size limit
Effective on Loading the TA Page Table Context, the maximum number of pages to allocate to the global list before signaling global list out of memory.

register.description: Effective immediately, this register defines the base address of the state table when it is read and written to/from memory. The state table itself contains the head, tail and number of pages allocated to every macrotile, and the global list. Each context needs a separate state page table.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 16Byte aligned Base Address for State Table in the DPM module.
Effective immediately, this field defines the which of the internal contexts is to be used for allocating memory
Effective immediately, this field defines the which of the internal contexts is to be used for de-allocating memory
Effective immediately, this field defines which of the internal contexts is to be loaded or stored from/to memory

register.description: Effective immediately, this register defines the base address of the control table when it is read and written to/from memory. The control table itself contains the current offset into the page, and whether a page has been allocated, for each macrotile. Each context needs a separate state page table.

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 16Byte aligned Base Address for the Control Table in the DPM module.

Effective on the loading of the TA Page Table Context, this register defines the number of the pages which are currently allocated to the context global list. The value for this register is read from the matching status register, on a context store, and loaded on a context load.

Effective on the loading of the TA Page Table Context, this register defines the number of the pages which are currently allocated to the context. The value for this register is read from the matching status register, on a context store, and loaded on a context load.
Effective on start render, this field indicates that the hardware should de-allocate Effective on start render, this field indicates that the hardware should de-allocate memory.mory.
Effective on start render, this field indicates that the hardware should de-allocate the memory associated with the global list if it is set.

register.description: A write to this register invalidates the current contents and causes a new allocation cycle

bitfield.description: Out of memory. Indicates that the action is pending due to an out of memory condition.
On a read a value of 1 in this field indicates that the page has been allocated, and that the page is valid.
A read of this register returns the page allocated to the host, when valid. If it is not valid the return data is undefined.

register.description: A write to this register invalidates the current contents and causes a new de-allocation cycle

bitfield.description: A read indicates whether the page has been freed
The page to be de-allocated by the hardware

Effective on Load TA Page Table Context: TA Alloc Free List Previous Page. The DPM maintains the previous and current free list pointers. On a context load this value must be loaded in. For the initial case it should be set to the penultimate page after initialisation (normally TAIL - 1).

Effective on Load 3D Page Table Context: 3D Free List Previous Page. The DPM maintains the previous and current free list pointers. On a context load this value must be loaded in. For the initial case it should be set to the penultimate page after initialisation (normally TAIL - 1).

Once The TA DPM has run out of memory, and the driver has scheduled an abort, there must be a partial render performed on the context in order to free memory. This bit is set before the partial render is started.
When set indicates that on a Context state table load, reset or store only the best macro tile, rather than the full scene.

Effective on the loading of the 3D Page Table Context, this register defines the number of the pages which are currently allocated to the context global list. The value for this register is read from the matching status register, on a context store, and loaded on a context load.

Effective on the loading of the 3D Page Table Context, this register defines the number of the pages which are currently allocated to the context. The value for this register is read from the matching status register, on a context store, and loaded on a context load.
Causes the 3D free list context to be loaded from the relevant configuration registers
Causes the TA free list context to be loaded from the relevant configuration registers

register.description: This register controls the DPM module task state for page tables. The normal order of operation is Store context, Clear context, Load new context.

bitfield.description: Causes the state for the DPM page table to be read from memory. Only the selected context ID is loaded.
Causes the state for the DPM page table to be cleared. Only the selected context ID is cleared.
Causes the state for the DPM page table (non-destructive - the state is not cleared as it is written) to be written to memory. Only the selected context ID is written out.

register.description: This register controls the DPM module task state for control page tables. The normal order of operation is Store context, Clear context, Load new context.

bitfield.description: Causes the state for the control page table to be read from memory.
Causes the state for the control page table to be cleared.
Causes the state for the control table (non-destructive - the control is not cleared as it is written) to be written to memory.

Causes the hardware to initiate the abort cycle, resulting in an abort complete, and requiring a subsequent full render, in the order of busiest to least busy macro tile. The region headers need to be re-ordered by the driver to guarantee this condition
Causes the hardware to initiate the abort cycle, resulting in an abort complete, and requiring a subsequent partial render
Causes the parameter management to resume trying to allocate pages
Causes the hardware to free the memory associated with the current TA context
Causes the hardware to free the memory associated with the current 3D context, and if a render is in progress, treat this as if it were complete.
Initialise the TA linked list (between start and end only), to an area of linear memory

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The current tail of the free list for the TA allocation context
The current head of the free list for the TA allocation context

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The current tail of the free list for the 3D context
The current head of the free list for the 3D context

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The element before the tail of the free list for the TA allocation context

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The element before the tail of the free list for the 3D context

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: Indicates that the whole scene must be aborted
The macro tile which will be aborted by the hardware

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The number of pages allocated by the hardware, for the TA context
The total number of pages allocated by the hardware, across all contexts

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The number of pages allocated by the hardware, for the 3D context

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The number of global pages allocated by the hardware, for the TA context
The total number of global pages allocated by the hardware, across all contexts

register.description: This status register is read for a context switch, and reprogrammed on a context load.

bitfield.description: The total number of global pages allocated by the hardware, across the 3D contexts
The device that is requesting memory; Bit 0 is the TA (Control Stream Request), Bit 1 is the TA (Vertex Data Stream Request)
The DPM Region Header IDLE indication, 1 = idle, 0 = busy
Disable filtering over edges/corners for CEM
Disable negation for user supplied gradients for cem swap i.e. will only swap dudx etc not negate

register.description: Unified Cache global control register

bitfield.description: Cache L0 Pipe1 Bypass

Cache Invalidate - To invalidate the cache, ie remove all contents from the cache, then setting this bit to 1 will start an invalidation cycle within the cache. Immediately the cache will not except anymore read request until the invalidation cycle completes. All requests pending in the cache (L0/L1/L2) will be completed before the cache completes its invalidation cycle. On completion of the invalidation cycle an interrupt will occur, if enabled, and the MADD_CACHE_INVALCOMP bit will be set and the cache will return to its normal operation

Cache Off L1 Pipe1 - When set to 1 turns off the L1 cache associated with Pipe 1. Read request to the L1 cache will be forwarded directly to the L2 cache. The cache must be invalidated after the bit is set to 0 (Cache Level On)

Cache Off L1 Pipe0 - When set to 1 turns off the L1 cache associated with Pipe 0. Read request to the L1 cache will be forwarded directly to the L2 cache. The cache must be invalidated after the bit is set to 0 (Cache Level On)

Cache Partition Mask for DM3 - defines which cache lines are used for Data Master type 3. Each bit represents one cache line, where there are 4 cache lines in the cache. Each cache line contains 8 possible address tags which are compared against the incoming address to determine if the data requested is in the cache or not. If all bits are set then there are 4 x 8 possible address tags i.e. DM3 read request will try and match against all the cache ram contents. Setting a bit to 0, will exclude that cache line from being compared against the incoming request address
Cache Partition Mask for DM2 - Refer to PARTDM3, but with respect to DM2
Cache Partition Mask for DM1 - Refer to PARTDM3, but with respect to DM1
Cache Partition Mask for DM0 - Refer to PARTDM3, but with respect to DM0
0: RETURN_ONE Controls whether out-of-range indexed-mode MOE register numbers redirect to 0 for alpha (when set) or 1 (when cleared) 0 RETURN_ONE 1 RETURN_ZERO
Maximum number of times an active slot can be serviced in a row
0x0 Off
Data master to kill
Byte-aligned memory address to redirect LD instructions which fail range check
Any write to this location invalidates the instruction cache automatically

register.description: Enables general event bits into the PDS event data master for processing by the PDS Micro Controller

bitfield.description: PDS_Enable: Lockup in TA Phase Trigger
PDS_Enable: Lockup in 3d Phase Trigger
PDS_Enable: Deadlock has occurred after a Partial Render
PDS_Enable: DPM 3D Task free load complete
PDS_Enable: DPM TA Task free load complete

PDS_Enable: Context ID 2 has been invalidated in PDS Data Store Cache 1

register.description: Enables general event bits into the PDS event data master for processing by the PDS Micro Controller

bitfield.description: PDS_Enable: The PDS Event timer interrupt (signalled on timer traversing through 0).
PDS_Enable: The TA Object Passing System has got out of sync, a Terminate Control Word DPM read was met by StartofBlock data

register.description: Base Address in memory where the PDS programs are located

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 1 MB aligned Base Address for PDS programs
Disable the internal timeout on PDS code performing necessary DOUT commands
The Start Chunk. There are 64 chunks of 32 DWords.

register.description: Base Address in memory where the Kick Synchronisation data will be read from

bitfield.description: 256MB Addressable, 16Byte aligned Base Address for Kick Synchronisation data
The kicker register, a write to this register triggers an increment of the PDS kicker.

register.description: The timer which runs at the core clock when enabled, decrementing from the loaded value. Wraps when it hits 0 back to the starting value. A transition through 0 creates an event, which can be enabled into either the PDS or the Host status register. The timer can also be read/written from within the PDS program.

bitfield.description: A value of '1' enables the timer, 0 disables the counter (halts without initialisation to 0).
The Starting value for the timer (loaded on write from wither PDS or host).

register.description: This USE can issue loopback tasks through the PDS back to itself. This bit indicates the status of this interface. A value of 1 should that there are no pending loopback requests (for any USE pipeline), A value of 0 indicates that a loop task is pending, and that further loopback events may cause the USE pipeline to wait until new resource becomes available. Issuing loopback events when tasks are already pending is not recommended, as this may result in system lockups.

bitfield.description: The Starting value for the timer (loaded on write from wither PDS or host).
